titleStmt.title: The maids chastity that is troubled in mind, against young-mens unconstancy, who proveth unkind: she gives warning to all maidens that are in the row, to take heed of false young men wheresoere they goe, to a pleasant new tune.

The maids chastity that is troubled in mind, against young-mens unconstancy, who proveth unkind: she gives warning to all maidens that are in the row, to take heed of false young men wheresoere they goe, to a pleasant new tune.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Richard Burton at the sign of the Horshooe in Smithfield,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "You young maids that would live ..."
In two parts, printed side by side.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
